required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Essential and Non-Essential Amino Acids on Post-Exercise Muscle Collagen Synthesis in Young Men
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Essential and Non-Essential Amino Acids on Post-Exercise Muscle Collagen Synthesis in Young Men: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess which amino acids are affecting acute muscle collagen synthesis in response to supplementation and exercise.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a double-blinded, randomized controlled, parallel design study, with 3 treatment groups (placebo, collagen peptide, and essential amino acid). The study will involve 3 visits: a baseline testing/familiarization session, and 2 exercise trials which will include muscle biopsies, blood draws, and the infusion of a tracer isotope in order to measure muscle protein synthesis.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: - Double-blinded, randomized controlled, parallel design study, with 3 treatment groups (placebo, collagen peptide, and essential amino acid)

primary_outcome.measure: Fractional synthetic rate (change over time) of Myofibrillar Protein Synthesis
primary_outcome.description: Fraction of the myofibrillar enriched protein from muscle biopsy per unit time.

primary_outcome.measure: Fractional synthetic rate (change over time) of Myofibrillar Protein Synthesis
primary_outcome.description: Fraction of the myofibrillar enriched protein from muscle biopsy per unit time.

primary_outcome.measure: Fractional synthetic rate (change over time) of Myofibrillar Protein Synthesis
primary_outcome.description: Fraction of the myofibrillar enriched protein from muscle biopsy per unit time.

primary_outcome.measure: Fractional synthetic rate (change over time) Muscle Collagen Synthesis
primary_outcome.description: Fraction of the intramuscular collagen enriched protein from muscle biopsy per unit time.

primary_outcome.measure: Fractional synthetic rate (change over time) Muscle Collagen Synthesis
primary_outcome.description: Fraction of the intramuscular collagen enriched protein from muscle biopsy per unit time.

primary_outcome.measure: Fractional synthetic rate (change over time) Muscle Collagen Synthesis
primary_outcome.description: Fraction of the intramuscular collagen enriched protein from muscle biopsy per unit time.
Osteoblastic marker of bone collagen synthesis
Osteoblastic marker of bone collagen synthesis

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Amino Acids Response to Supplementation
Muscle mechanistic target of rapamycin Pathway Activation
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring the fold change in enzymes associated with the anabolic signalling of the mTOR pathway (e.g. phosphoinositide 3-kinases (PI3k), protein kinase B (Akt))

secondary_outcome.measure: PCR Gene Expression of Muscle Collagen Genes (Types I, III, IV)
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring the fold change when the collagen genes of interest become detectable in the PCR analysis

arm_group.description: Participants will consume 1 dose of: 15 g crystalline essential amino acid supplement (Pure Encapsulation Essential Aminos 180) + 80 ml (48 mg) Vitamin C (Ribena Blackcurrant) + 250 ml water
Participants will consume 1 dose of: 15g collagen peptide (Gelita TENDOFORTE) + 80 ml (48 mg) Vitamin C (Ribena Blackcurrant) + 250 ml water
Participants will consume 1 dose of:15 g maltodextrin (Canadian Protein Maltodextrin) + 80 ml (48 mg) Vitamin C (Ribena Blackcurrant) + 250 ml water

intervention.description: Immediately following the exercise intervention participants will consume their assigned essential amino acid supplement
Immediately following the exercise intervention participants will consume their assigned collagen peptide supplement
Immediately following the exercise intervention participants will consume their assigned maltodextrin supplement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Can fluently read and write in English
- Male
- 18 - 35 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes, cardiovascular disease, or current pharmaceutical therapy
- Medical conditions impacting ability to undertake strenuous physical activity
- Lower body resistance training in the previous 6 months
- BMI > 30
- Currently smoking with cigarettes
- Allergy to any study supplements
- Currently taking any protein, amino acid, or collagen supplement
- Participate in greater than 2 hours of weekly vigorous exercise
